memberdef.type: std::conditional_t< std::is_pointer_v< T >, tainted_volatile< detail::dereference_result_t< T >, T_Sbx >, T_Wrap< detail::dereference_result_t< T >, T_Sbx > >
memberdef.definition: using rlbox::tainted_base_impl< T_Wrap, T, T_Sbx >::T_OpSubscriptArrRet = std::conditional_t< std::is_pointer_v<T>, tainted_volatile<detail::dereference_result_t<T>, T_Sbx>, T_Wrap<detail::dereference_result_t<T>, T_Sbx> >

memberdef.definition: using rlbox::tainted_base_impl< T_Wrap, T, T_Sbx >::T_OpDerefRet = tainted_volatile<std::remove_pointer_t<T>, T_Sbx>
memberdef.name: T_OpDerefRet

briefdescription.para: Unwrap a tainted value without verification. This is an unsafe operation and should be used with care.
Like UNSAFE_unverified, but get the underlying sandbox representation.

detaileddescription.para:
sandbox
Reference to sandbox.
For the Wasm-based sandbox, this function additionally validates the unwrapped value against the machine model of the sandbox (LP32).

memberdef.argsstring: (template< size_t N > inline auto unverified_safe_because(const char(&reason)[N]), { RLBOX_UNUSED(reason);static_assert(!std::is_pointer_v< T >, "unverified_safe_because does not support pointers. Use " "unverified_safe_pointer_because.");return UNSAFE_unverified();})
memberdef.name: rlbox_detail_member_and_const

param.type: { RLBOX_UNUSED(reason);static_assert(!std::is_pointer_v< T >, "unverified_safe_because does not support pointers. Use " "unverified_safe_pointer_because.");return UNSAFE_unverified();}

briefdescription.para: Unwrap a tainted value without verification. This function should be used when unwrapping is safe.

parameterdescription.para: An explanation why the unverified unwrapping is safe.

memberdef.argsstring: (template< size_t N > inline auto unverified_safe_pointer_because(size_t count, const char(&reason)[N]), { RLBOX_UNUSED(reason);static_assert(std::is_pointer_v< T >, "Expected pointer type");using T_Pointed=std::remove_pointer_t< T >;if_constexpr_named(cond1, std::is_pointer_v< T_Pointed >) { rlbox_detail_static_fail_because(cond1, "There is no way to use unverified_safe_pointer_because for " "'pointers to pointers' safely. Use copy_and_verify instead.");return nullptr;} auto ret=UNSAFE_unverified();if(ret !=nullptr) { size_t bytes=sizeof(T) *count;detail::check_range_doesnt_cross_app_sbx_boundary< T_Sbx >(ret, bytes);} return ret;})
memberdef.name: rlbox_detail_member_and_const

param.type: { RLBOX_UNUSED(reason);static_assert(std::is_pointer_v< T >, "Expected pointer type");using T_Pointed=std::remove_pointer_t< T >;if_constexpr_named(cond1, std::is_pointer_v< T_Pointed >) { rlbox_detail_static_fail_because(cond1, "There is no way to use unverified_safe_pointer_because for " "'pointers to pointers' safely. Use copy_and_verify instead.");return nullptr;} auto ret=UNSAFE_unverified();if(ret !=nullptr) { size_t bytes=sizeof(T) *count;detail::check_range_doesnt_cross_app_sbx_boundary< T_Sbx >(ret, bytes);} return ret;}

memberdef.definition: const T_OpSubscriptArrRet & rlbox::tainted_base_impl< T_Wrap, T, T_Sbx >::operator[]
memberdef.name: operator[]

briefdescription.para: Copy tainted value from sandbox and verify it.

parameterdescription.para: Function used to verify the copied value.

briefdescription.para: Copy a range of tainted values from sandbox and verify them.

parameterdescription.para: Function used to verify the copied value.
the type of the verifier. If the tainted type is int* then T_Func = T_Ret(*)(unique_ptr<int[]>).

briefdescription.para: Copy a tainted string from sandbox and verify it.

parameterdescription.para: Function used to verify the copied value.
the type of the verifier either T_Ret(*)(unique_ptr<char[]>) or T_Ret(*)(std::string)

briefdescription.para: Copy a tainted pointer from sandbox and verify the address.

detaileddescription.para: This function is useful if you need to verify physical bits representing the address of a pointer. Other APIs such as copy_and_verify performs a deep copy and changes the address bits.

parameterdescription.para: Function used to verify the copied value.
the type of the verifier T_Ret(*)(uintptr_t)

briefdescription.para: Copy a tainted pointer to a buffer from sandbox and verify the address.

detaileddescription.para: This function is useful if you need to verify physical bits representing the address of a buffer. Other APIs such as copy_and_verify performs a deep copy and changes the address bits.

parameterdescription.para: Function used to verify the copied value.
Size of the buffer. Buffer with length size is expected to fit inside sandbox memory.
the type of the verifier T_Ret(*)(uintptr_t)

memberdef.definition: const void * rlbox::tainted_base_impl< T_Wrap, T, T_Sbx >::verify_range_helper
memberdef.name: verify_range_helper

memberdef.definition: std::unique_ptr< T_CopyAndVerifyRangeEl[]> rlbox::tainted_base_impl< T_Wrap, T, T_Sbx >::copy_and_verify_range_helper
memberdef.name: copy_and_verify_range_helper
